intro: Clematis revoluta, commonly known as the Japanese vine, is a deciduous climbing plant native to East Asia. It features striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, twining stems that can reach lengths of up to 10 meters, allowing it to climb trees or trellises. Its foliage consists of trifoliate leaves, with each leaflet being ovate and slightly hairy. Clematis revoluta prefers partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental climbing plants.
